author: .vbuterin
content: Was there ever a "proper EIP" proposed corresponding to the EVM memory bound changes that I proposed?

author: .vbuterin
content: Would there be enthusiasm if I write it?

author: _shemnon
content: Getting it into prague would be tricky.  Stapling it onto EOF would make EOF harder to ship.  Given we have removing gas introspection as a feature of EOF we can transparently change the gas costing of memory without wedging contracts.

author: _shemnon
content: It's legacy I'm concerned about tweaking gas schedules in. I think we need to see the impact on older contracts, so we know what we break.

author: _shemnon
content: I think it's a good one for Amsterdam (Next+2, late '25/early '26) or maybe possibly Osaka (Next+1 early-mid '25) but Verkle has explicitly stated the want the whole Osaka fork to themselves.
